body_html:
@zszhong I use TF by building it from source, not from official wheel(which is linked against CUDA 7.5 / cuDNN 5).

@vrv Understood. Sometimes I'd like to run TF without any GPU use along with GPU-using TF running. Installing two versions of TF (using virtualenv) might help, but I was curious if I can disable GPU feature completely using CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES. This issue isn't crutial issues than other Tons of issues, but It would be awesome if single wheel file works both GPU and CPU version. I'll remain this issue be open.

body:
@zszhong I use TF by building it from source, not from official wheel(which is linked against CUDA 7.5 / cuDNN 5).

@vrv Understood. Sometimes I'd like to run TF without any GPU use along with GPU-using TF running. Installing two versions of TF (using virtualenv) might help, but I was curious if I can disable GPU feature completely using `CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES`. This issue isn't crutial issues than other Tons of issues, but It would be awesome if single wheel file works both GPU and CPU version. I'll remain this issue be open.
